> [basxto](#comment_19_1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k): Maybe (anonymous) comments would be a nice extra. Sometimes you just feel like a question is too squishy or that an answer misses some important additional point

Comments are planned for the next bigger update, maybe this weekend if I find the time, but not anonymous, the comments are like the votes tied to the ZeroID you are logged in with. But there are multiple people working on ZeroID services in addition to ZeroID.bit now, so you will at some point be able to select one additional ID provider to use for ZeroPolls, then you can use one ZeroID as an anonymous throwaway account separate from your main identity. People would in effect be able to vote twice if they logged in with both their ZeroIDs one after another, but not more than that, so nobody can really rig the vote by voting a hundred times or something like that.

It depends on the speed of your internet connection, not the size of the file. The limit here is a timeout for downloads ZeroNet has set.
